taxonConcepts.nameAccordingTo: Species 2000 & ITIS Catalogue of Life: April 2013

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Occurs in pebbly beds in swift currents at the base of hills (Ref. 4833).  Found among rocks and boulders on the bottom of fast flowing upland streams.  Diet consists of aquatic insects.  Not seen in markets (Ref. 12693).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.references: Talwar, P.K. and A.G. Jhingran 1991 Inland fishes of India and adjacent countries. Volume 2. A.A. Balkema, Rotterdam. (Ref. 4833)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Size
dataObjects.title: Max. size
dataObjects.references: Talwar, P.K. and A.G. Jhingran 1991 Inland fishes of India and adjacent countries. Volume 2. A.A. Balkema, Rotterdam. (Ref. 4833)

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.rightsHolder: مركز الأسماك العالمى. قاعدة بيانات الأسماك
dataObjects.description: تختلف عن الأنواع A. mucronatum, A. murraystuarti, A. platycephalus, A. foratum والنوع A.  variegatum في أن له جسم قصير نسبياً له 34 - 36  فقرة (مقابل 38 - 40 فقرة) والزعنفة الذيلية بفصيها العلوي والسفلي ذات شكل مميز واضح (مقابل زعنفة مبتورة في النوع  A. murraystuarti، وكلا الفصين متشابهين في الأنواع الهندية الصينية الأخرى)، الشوكة الصدرية ملساء (المرجع 37785).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#DiagnosticDescription
dataObjects.description: Differs from A. mucronatum, A. murraystuarti, A. platycephalus, A. foratum and A. variegatum in having a relatively short body with 34-36 (versus 38-40) vertebrae, and a caudal fin with upper and lower lobes fo distinctly different shapes (versus truncate caudal fin in A. murraystuarti and with both lobes similar in shape in other Indochinese species).  Pectoral spine smooth (Ref. 37785).
